title: Effect of volume change on NOCl equilibrium

content.question:
<math alttext="2 N O gas plus C l 2 gas is in equilibrium with 2 N O C l gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>NO(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>Cl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>⇄</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>NOCl(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="K sub c is equal to 2000" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>c</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>2000</mn></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>
A mixture of <math alttext="N O gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>NO(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="C l 2 gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Cl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is placed in a previously evacuated container and allowed to reach equilibrium according to the chemical equation shown above. When the system reaches equilibrium, the reactants and products have the concentrations listed in the following table.
Species Concentration (<math alttext="molar" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>) <math alttext="N O gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>NO(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> 0.050 <math alttext="C l 2 gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Cl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> 0.050 <math alttext="N O C l gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>NOCl(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> 0.50 
Which of the following is true if the volume of the container is decreased by one half?

choices.label: <math alttext="Q equals 100" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Q</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>100</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the reaction will proceed toward reactants.
<math alttext="Q equals 100" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Q</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>100</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the reaction will proceed toward products.
<math alttext="Q equals 1000" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Q</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1000</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the reaction will proceed toward reactants.
<math alttext="Q equals 1000" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Q</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1000</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the reaction will proceed toward products.

content.answer: <math alttext="Q equals 1000" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Q</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1000</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the reaction will proceed toward products.

topic.text: 7.10: Reaction Quotient and Le Châtelier's Principle

skill.text: 5.F: Calculate, estimate, or predict an unknown quantity from known quantities by selecting and following a logical computational pathway and attending to precision (e.g., performing dimensional analysis and attending to significant figures).
